page.title: 15INDUSTRY IN COLYTON part 1
page.content: The only factory in this area is Hoechst CeramTec, a German company. They make fuses from clay. Waste clay is added to water and put through a drum mixer, agitator, filter press and vacuum press to produce raw clay that can be used for moulding into the right shape for different fuses. This is done on presses. The result is then put in a kiln at 630-820 degrees C. It is then cut to size. Then they are put through kilns at 1300 dgrees C. They are taken to the grinders, which grind 75000 fuses in the 8 hours that the workers work each day. They are then washed, dried and tumbled for 2 to 102 hours depending on the fuse. They are then checked. Some are coated with silicon, others have their ends coated with silver. They are packed and sent all over the world.
